meanings.definition: The way in which something is expressed in words or actions.
meanings.sent1: Her phrasings in the speech were clear and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: I appreciated the phrasings in the poem for their beauty and emotion.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's phrasings had the audience laughing throughout the show.
meanings.sent4: The phrasings of the song painted a vivid picture of love and loss.
meanings.sent5: His phrasings in the letter conveyed his deep feelings of gratitude.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of words in a sentence or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The phrasings in the essay were well-structured and organized.
meanings.sent2: I struggled with the phrasings of the foreign language, but eventually learned.
meanings.sent3: The phrasings in the book were so jumbled that it was hard to follow the plot.
meanings.sent4: Her poetic phrasings danced off the page and into the reader's heart.
meanings.sent5: The phrasings in the speech flowed smoothly, captivating the audience.
